title: Seeking Friendship First ...hoping to find something more!
text:
Looking for that special person to become friends with and see what happens. Ideally seeking that special person for a LTR. If you are too, read on. 

Please only respond if you live in Nassau County, Queens or NYC. If you live in New Jersey, Connecticut or Mass. Sorry but I'm not looking for a long distance relationship or pen pal. Do Not respond if you are a man (stop trolling the W4W site creep!), a woman looking for a three-way with your husband or boyfriend, Married (to a man or woman), a Bi Woman, or a woman experimenting to see if she is gay. 
Please do not respond if you are not available to date or have issues (i.e. an ex that you aren't over) that prevent you from forming and maintaining a healthy, LTR. I have had LTR's and I am looking for someone that wants to take the time to get to know one another (friendship is an important foundation) and see where it goes.
Please only respond if you are stable (emotionally and financially). 

For those of you interested in becoming friends and possibly more, and are looking for the same thing as I am, please continue reading.

I ran this post before and met a number of very nice women who have become great friends. I also had a few wackos (liars, phonies and mentally imbalanced women) and a few men posing as women. Soooo, I am still looking for that special someone to respond. If you like what I wrote below, and think that you might be the missing puzzle piece in my life and yours, please take a chance and write me back! The worse that can happen is that you make a new friend. 

It's almost a new year and hope springs eternal! I have responded to a number of posts on CL and have been lucky to have met some amazing women. Since ending a long-term relationship, I thought it was time that I got back in the game and put up a Posting. I am serious about meeting someone to become friends with ( go to movies, golf, galleries, shopping, dinners with, etc.) and see where that goes. A LTR is the ultimate goal, but that doesn't form instantly. It takes time and that/s where the friendship plays a big role. If you don't want that, are incapable of this, or are still mourning the end of a relationship, this post isn't for you.

I am an attractive, professional, SWF, 53 (who looks 10 years younger!after we VV we can exchange pics), looking to meet someone, date and see where it goes. I prefer dating professional White femme women, AGES 45-55 (that's my choice, not necessarily yours). 
If you're in your twenties or thirties, this probably won't be a good fit because we probably have very little in common. Yes I said DATE, so if you are looking for NSA or someone to send genital photos to, please move on. I know that there are a lot of wacko's on this site (I've unfortunately corresponded with and met a few) but I know that there are also some wonderful people out there--somewhere out there is a diamond in the rough! 
I am seeking someone who like me is also on a journey, looking for that special relationship to complete an otherwise great life. Someone to share a life with and all that comes with it. Please only respond if you are willing to form a friendship first so we can see if there is anything else there. I don't want to play email tag forever, speak endlessly without meeting, or juggle a busy schedule to set up a date to have it canceled at the last minute or have someone be a rude no show! Please be real and serious about meeting someone. I live on Western Long Island and work in NYC.

If you have not gotten over your ex (and you are just testing the waters, please don't waste my time), if you don't understand that a relationship requires compromise to work and last, have commitment issues, can't reciprocate affection, find normal boring, need psychiatric help (not that there's anything wrong with that, but no thanks! I've been down that road already and honestly, it's too much work and not healthy), have other people in your life that you're involved with (women or men), don't like children (although mine are grown), smoke, are a neurotic vegetarian, don't work or can't tell the truth, please move on.

Because I am an optimist and believe my soulmate is out there looking too, I am ready to find that someone who makes my heart beat faster when we're together (and even when we're not!).

A little about me: As I stated above, I am a SWF, professional, attractive woman looking to date and see where that goes. I am a single mom to 2 teenagers, a 21 year old and a 18 year old. They sometimes live at home on school breaks.
I also have a wonderful rescue dog. If that's a problem, this post isn't for you. I am open to another professional woman who has children (teenagers or older) or who doesn't. You need to understand I have a big heart and I have room for the love of family AND a GF! Hope you do too....

Intelligence and a sense of humor is as important as looks to me, so reading, laughing and being able to maintain a conversation is very important. I have a very dry, sometimes sarcastic sense of humor so if we do date, we will laugh a lot. I think laughter is highly underrated!

I love nice dinners, fine wine, movies, hitting the street fairs and flea markets in the City, Broadway Shows, music/concerts, museums, galleries, any water sports, travel, golf (on a real course, although hitting it past the windmill is fun sometimes too!), working out at the gym a few times a week, a good Happy Hour and HONESTY. I'm tired of unnecessary drama and I have no tolerance for liars.
I would love to find someone who could become a friend and then something more. I'm an attractive athletic femme (5'3",strawberry blond hair, hazel eyes, fit) and I've been told that I am pretty/cute (or so I've been told by men and women!).

Stability, both emotional and financial, is important. We all have issues and baggage if we have lived our lives, just be in control of yours. If you have issues that prevent you from having a normal, healthy relationship, this post is not for you.

If you are interested, I would like to e-mail (briefly) and if we seem to enjoy communicating with each other, have some things in common or just make each other laugh, then a phone call and perhaps meeting up for a drink (alcohol or coffee works), would be great. I don't want to play e-mail tag forever. As to a photo, if we hit it off, we can exchange photos. We will have to voice verify. There are too many guys collecting our photos out there.

Take a chance! What do you have to lose? If nothing else, you could make a new friend and wing-woman to continue our search for that special someone! I hope to hear from you!

Yes I said DATE, so if you are looking for NSA or someone to send genital photos to, please move on. I know that there are a lot of wacko's on this site (I've unfortunately corresponded with and met a few) but I know that there are also some wonderful people out there--somewhere out there is a diamond in the rough! 
I am seeking someone who like me is also on a journey, looking for that special relationship to complete an otherwise great life. Someone to share a life with and all that comes with it. Please only respond if you are willing to form a friendship first so we can see if there is anything else there. I don't want to play email tag forever, speak endlessly without meeting, or juggle a busy schedule to set up a date to have it canceled at the last minute or have someone be a rude no show! Please be real and serious about meeting someone. I live on Western Long Island and work in NYC.

If you have not gotten over your ex (and you are just testing the waters, please don't waste my time), if you don't understand that a relationship requires compromise to work and last, have commitment issues, can't reciprocate affection, find normal boring, need psychiatric help (not that there's anything wrong with that, but no thanks! I've been down that road already and honestly, it's too much work and not healthy), have other people in your life that you're involved with (women or men), don't like children (although mine are grown), smoke, are a neurotic vegetarian, don't work or can't tell the truth, please move on.

Because I am an optimist and believe my soulmate is out there looking too, I am ready to find that someone who makes my heart beat faster when we're together (and even when we're not!).

A little about me: As I stated above, I am a SWF, professional, attractive woman looking to date and see where that goes. I am a single mom to 2 teenagers, a 21 year old and a 18 year old. They sometimes live at home on school breaks.
I also have a wonderful rescue dog. If that's a problem, this post isn't for you. I am open to another professional woman who has children (teenagers or older) or who doesn't. You need to understand I have a big heart and I have room for the love of family AND a GF! Hope you do too....

Intelligence and a sense of humor is as important as looks to me, so reading, laughing and being able to maintain a conversation is very important. I have a very dry, sometimes sarcastic sense of humor so if we do date, we will laugh a lot. I think laughter is highly underrated!

I love nice dinners, fine wine, movies, hitting the street fairs and flea markets in the City, Broadway Shows, music/concerts, museums, galleries, any water sports, travel, golf (on a real course, although hitting it past the windmill is fun sometimes too!), working out at the gym a few times a week, a good Happy Hour and HONESTY. I'm tired of unnecessary drama and I have no tolerance for liars.
I would love to find someone who could become a friend and then something more. I'm an attractive athletic femme (5'3",strawberry blond hair, hazel eyes, fit) and I've been told that I am pretty/cute (or so I've been told by men and women!).

Stability, both emotional and financial, is important. We all have issues and baggage if we have lived our lives, just be in control of yours. If you have issues that prevent you from having a normal, healthy relationship, this post is not for you.

If you are interested, I would like to e-mail (briefly) and if we seem to enjoy communicating with each other, have some things in common or just make each other laugh, then a phone call and perhaps meeting up for a drink (alcohol or coffee works), would be great. I don't want to play e-mail tag forever. As to a photo, if we hit it off, we can exchange photos. We will have to voice verify. There are too many guys collecting our photos out there.

Take a chance! What do you have to lose? If nothing else, you could make a new friend and wing-woman to continue our search for that special someone! I hope to hear from you!

title: I need certainty...

Here's a question that I've been pondering about for at least six years. AND I'M NOT a self-righteous person! I'd just like to understand...Why is it that some people feel that it's necessary to put on a mask when they are interested in someone new, and then slowly proceed to remove it as time passes on in the relationship? What's the problem with showing someone who you really are right off the bat? Now, I'm most certainly or by any means saying that I'm without flaws. But my no means would I judge anyone for theirs. In every relationship I've been in I learned to adapt to the qualities of my then partners and evolved because it. I've learned to be strong minded, speak my mind, and not be bullied by someone else. I learned that one has to have figured out one's own self and accept one's self before loving and accepting someone new in their lives. And I also that it's important to have time to yourself to think and meditate about your own life. 
That being said, I've had my heart punched around a few times, probably because I wear it on my sleeve. (bad joke. Lol.) I've been told by many people, even some exs , that I'm "too nice" I'm not quite sure how to take that, but I know that I don't have it in me to be mean or cold hearted with a person I like or love. I think it's essential to show kindness to others. Even those who are not deserving of it. That's what my mother though me as a young girl and I keep that in mind to this day. Unfortunately most of the people I've been involved with didn't feel the same way. Which brings me to you all on CL. Why not?

title: Seeking Friendship First ...hoping to find something more!
text:
Looking for that special person to become friends with and see what happens. Ideally seeking that special person for a LTR. If you are too, read on. 

Please only respond if you live in Nassau County, Queens or NYC. If you live in New Jersey, Connecticut or Mass. Sorry but I'm not looking for a long distance relationship or pen pal. Do Not respond if you are a man (stop trolling the W4W site creep!), a woman looking for a three-way with your husband or boyfriend, Married (to a man or woman), a Bi Woman, or a woman experimenting to see if she is gay. 
Please do not respond if you are not available to date or have issues (i.e. an ex that you aren't over) that prevent you from forming and maintaining a healthy, LTR. I have had LTR's and I am looking for someone that wants to take the time to get to know one another (friendship is an important foundation) and see where it goes.
Please only respond if you are stable (emotionally and financially). 

For those of you interested in becoming friends and possibly more, and are looking for the same thing as I am, please continue reading.

I ran this post before and met a number of very nice women who have become great friends. I also had a few wackos (liars, phonies and mentally imbalanced women) and a few men posing as women. Soooo, I am still looking for that special someone to respond. If you like what I wrote below, and think that you might be the missing puzzle piece in my life and yours, please take a chance and write me back! The worse that can happen is that you make a new friend. 

It's almost a new year and hope springs eternal! I have responded to a number of posts on CL and have been lucky to have met some amazing women. Since ending a long-term relationship, I thought it was time that I got back in the game and put up a Posting. I am serious about meeting someone to become friends with ( go to movies, golf, galleries, shopping, dinners with, etc.) and see where that goes. A LTR is the ultimate goal, but that doesn't form instantly. It takes time and that/s where the friendship plays a big role. If you don't want that, are incapable of this, or are still mourning the end of a relationship, this post isn't for you.

I am an attractive, professional, SWF, 53 (who looks 10 years younger!after we VV we can exchange pics), looking to meet someone, date and see where it goes. I prefer dating professional White femme women, AGES 45-55 (that's my choice, not necessarily yours). 
If you're in your twenties or thirties, this probably won't be a good fit because we probably have very little in common. Yes I said DATE, so if you are looking for NSA or someone to send genital photos to, please move on. I know that there are a lot of wacko's on this site (I've unfortunately corresponded with and met a few) but I know that there are also some wonderful people out there--somewhere out there is a diamond in the rough! 
I am seeking someone who like me is also on a journey, looking for that special relationship to complete an otherwise great life. Someone to share a life with and all that comes with it. Please only respond if you are willing to form a friendship first so we can see if there is anything else there. I don't want to play email tag forever, speak endlessly without meeting, or juggle a busy schedule to set up a date to have it canceled at the last minute or have someone be a rude no show! Please be real and serious about meeting someone. I live on Western Long Island and work in NYC.

If you have not gotten over your ex (and you are just testing the waters, please don't waste my time), if you don't understand that a relationship requires compromise to work and last, have commitment issues, can't reciprocate affection, find normal boring, need psychiatric help (not that there's anything wrong with that, but no thanks! I've been down that road already and honestly, it's too much work and not healthy), have other people in your life that you're involved with (women or men), don't like children (although mine are grown), smoke, are a neurotic vegetarian, don't work or can't tell the truth, please move on.

Because I am an optimist and believe my soulmate is out there looking too, I am ready to find that someone who makes my heart beat faster when we're together (and even when we're not!).

A little about me: As I stated above, I am a SWF, professional, attractive woman looking to date and see where that goes. I am a single mom to 2 teenagers, a 21 year old and a 18 year old. They sometimes live at home on school breaks.
I also have a wonderful rescue dog. If that's a problem, this post isn't for you. I am open to another professional woman who has children (teenagers or older) or who doesn't. You need to understand I have a big heart and I have room for the love of family AND a GF! Hope you do too....

Intelligence and a sense of humor is as important as looks to me, so reading, laughing and being able to maintain a conversation is very important. I have a very dry, sometimes sarcastic sense of humor so if we do date, we will laugh a lot. I think laughter is highly underrated!

I love nice dinners, fine wine, movies, hitting the street fairs and flea markets in the City, Broadway Shows, music/concerts, museums, galleries, any water sports, travel, golf (on a real course, although hitting it past the windmill is fun sometimes too!), working out at the gym a few times a week, a good Happy Hour and HONESTY. I'm tired of unnecessary drama and I have no tolerance for liars.
I would love to find someone who could become a friend and then something more. I'm an attractive athletic femme (5'3",strawberry blond hair, hazel eyes, fit) and I've been told that I am pretty/cute (or so I've been told by men and women!).

Stability, both emotional and financial, is important. We all have issues and baggage if we have lived our lives, just be in control of yours. If you have issues that prevent you from having a normal, healthy relationship, this post is not for you.

If you are interested, I would like to e-mail (briefly) and if we seem to enjoy communicating with each other, have some things in common or just make each other laugh, then a phone call and perhaps meeting up for a drink (alcohol or coffee works), would be great. I don't want to play e-mail tag forever. As to a photo, if we hit it off, we can exchange photos. We will have to voice verify. There are too many guys collecting our photos out there.

Take a chance! What do you have to lose? If nothing else, you could make a new friend and wing-woman to continue our search for that special someone! I hope to hear from you!
